prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.75, 0.0]. Next, create the 2D sketch on the XY plane defined by the coordinate system. 1. Face 1 1. Loop 1 1. Line 1: Draw a line from the point (0.0, 0.0) to the point (0.0048, 0.0). 2. Line 2: Draw a line from the point (0.0048, 0.0) to the point (0.0048, 0.6587). 3. Line 3: Draw a line from the point (0.0048, 0.6587) to the point (0.0, 0.6587). 4. Line 4: Draw a line from the point (0.0, 0.6587) to the point (0.0, 0.0). Now, scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.6587. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.75, 0.0). Lastly, extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the 'extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal' to 0.75 and 'extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal' to 0.0. The height of the prism is equal to half the length of the sides, so set 'sketch\\_scale' to 0.6587. This completes the first part with the 'NewBodyFeatureOperation'. The length and width of this part are 0.6587, and the height is 0.6587. Proceed with constructing the following parts, referring to their respective instructions.</description>

The final shape is a long, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, a tall cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom (wider at the top) and a smaller cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom (resembling a simplified representation of a cone) added on top of the prism.</description>
